com.wuest.prefab

Class BuildingMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wuest.prefab.BuildingMethods

  • public class BuildingMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to hold he generalized building methods used by the starting house.
    Author:
    WuestMan

    • Method Detail

      • ClearSpace

        public static void ClearSpace(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                              net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos startingPosition,
                              int width,
                              int height,
                              int depth,
                              net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing houseFacing)
        Clears the given space without returning any of the drops.
        Parameters:
        world - - The world used to clear the space.
        startingPosition - - The starting position, note the width, depth will be used to determine the starting corner(s).
        width - - The radius x-axis of how wide to clear. (East/West)
        height - - How high from the starting position to clear (this includes starting position).
        depth - - The radius z-axis of how deep to clear. (North/South).
        houseFacing - This is used to determine which direction the clearing should start.

      • ClearSpaceExact

        public static void ClearSpaceExact(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                   net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos startingPosition,
                                   int width,
                                   int height,
                                   int depth,
                                   net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing houseFacing)
        Clears the given space without returning any of the drops.
        Parameters:
        world - - The world used to clear the space.
        startingPosition - - The starting position, note the width, depth will be used to determine the starting corner(s).
        width - - The radius x-axis of how wide to clear. (East/West)
        height - - How high from the starting position to clear (this includes starting position).
        depth - - The radius z-axis of how deep to clear. (North/South)
        houseFacing - This is used to determine which direction the clearing should start.

      • ConsolidateDrops

        public static java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.ItemStack> ConsolidateDrops(net.minecraft.block.Block block,
                                                                                 net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                                                                 net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                                                                 net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState state,
                                                                                 java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.ItemStack> originalStacks,
                                                                                 java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.Item> itemsToNotAdd)
        This method consolidate drops for the current block into an existing ArrayList
        Parameters:
        block - The block to get the drops from.
        world - The world which the block resides.
        pos - The block position.
        state - The current block state.
        originalStacks - The original list of stacks.
        itemsToNotAdd - The items to not add to the list.
        Returns:
        An updated list of item stacks.

      • CreateWall

        public static java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.ItemStack> CreateWall(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                                                           int height,
                                                                           int length,
                                                                           net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing direction,
                                                                           net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos startingPosition,
                                                                           net.minecraft.block.Block replacementBlock,
                                                                           java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.Item> itemsToNotAdd)
        Creates a wall of blocks.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to create the wall.
        height - The height of the wall.
        length - The length of the wall.
        direction - The direction of the wall.
        startingPosition - Where the wall should start.
        replacementBlock - The block to create the wall out of.
        itemsToNotAdd - When consolidating drops, the items to not include in the returned list.
        Returns:
        An Arraylist of Itemstacks which contains the drops from any destroyed blocks.

      • CreateWall

        public static java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.ItemStack> CreateWall(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                                                           int height,
                                                                           int length,

                                                                           net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos startingPosition,
                                                                           net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState replacementBlock)

        Parameters:
        world - The world to create the wall.
        height - The height of the wall.
        length - The length of the wall.
        direction - The direction of the wall.
        startingPosition - Where the wall should start.
        replacementBlock - The block to create the wall out of.
        Returns:
        An Arraylist of Itemstacks which contains the drops from any destroyed blocks.

      • SetFloor

        public static java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.ItemStack> SetFloor(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                                                         net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                                                         net.minecraft.block.Block block,
                                                                         int width,
                                                                         int depth,
                                                                         java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.ItemStack> originalStack,
                                                                         net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing facing,
                                                                         java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.Item> itemsToNotAdd)
        Creates a square floor of blocks.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to create the floor in.
        pos - The block position to start creating the floor.
        block - The Type of block to create the floor out of.
        width - The width of the floor.
        depth - The length of the floor.
        originalStack - The original stack of items from previously harvested blocks.
        facing - The direction of the floor.
        itemsToNotAdd - The items to not include in the returned consolidated items.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Itemstacks which contains the drops from all harvested blocks.

      • SetCeiling

        public static void SetCeiling(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                              net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                              net.minecraft.block.Block block,
                              int width,
                              int depth,
                              net.minecraft.block.Block stairs,
                              HouseConfiguration configuration,
                              net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing houseFacing,
                              java.util.ArrayList<net.minecraft.item.Item> itemsToNotAdd)
        Creates a ceiling (floating floor) in the world.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to create the floor in.
        pos - The block position to start creating the floor.
        block - The Type of block to create the floor out of.
        width - The width of the floor.
        depth - The length of the floor.
        stairs - The type of block to create the roof out of.
        configuration - The house configuration object. This is specifically used in the basic house.
        houseFacing - The direction to start the ceiling.
        itemsToNotAdd - The items to not include in the harvested blocks.

      • ReplaceBlock

        public static void ReplaceBlock(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                net.minecraft.block.Block replacementBlock)
        Replaces a block at the given position in the world. The block in the pos will be replaced with air before placing the block;
        Parameters:
        world - The world object.
        pos - The position to update.
        replacementBlock - The block object to place at this position. The default state is used.

      • ReplaceBlockNoAir

        public static void ReplaceBlockNoAir(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                     net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                     net.minecraft.block.Block replacementBlock)
        Replaces a block at the given position in the world. This is faster as the position is not set to air first.
        Parameters:
        world - The world object.
        pos - The position to update.
        replacementBlock - The block object to place at this position. The default state is used.

      • ReplaceBlock

        public static void ReplaceBlock(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState replacementBlockState)
        Replaces a block at the given position in the world. The block in the pos will be replaced with air before placing the block;
        Parameters:
        world - The world object.
        pos - The position to update.
        replacementBlockState - The block state to place at this position.

      • ReplaceBlockNoAir

        public static void ReplaceBlockNoAir(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                     net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                     net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState replacementBlockState)

        pos - The position to update.
        replacementBlockState - The block state to place at this position.

      • ReplaceBlock

        public static void ReplaceBlock(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState replacementBlockState,
                                int flags)
        Replaces a block at the given position in the world. The block in the pos will be replaced with air before placing the block;
        Parameters:
        world - The world object.
        pos - The position to update.
        replacementBlockState - The block state to place at this position.
        flags - The trigger flags, this should always be set to 3 so the clients are updated.

      • ReplaceBlockNoAir

        public static void ReplaceBlockNoAir(net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                     net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos,
                                     net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState replacementBlockState,
                                     int flags)
        Replaces a block at the given position in the world. This is faster as the position is not set to air first.
        Parameters:
        world - The world object.
        pos - The position to update.
        replacementBlockState - The block state to place at this position.
        flags - The trigger flags, this should always be set to 3 so the clients are updated.

      • GetTorchFacing

        public static int GetTorchFacing(net.minecraft.util.EnumFacing facing)
        Gets the integer representation of a torch facing.
        Parameters:
        facing - The facing that the torch should look.
        Returns:
        The integer used for the block state of a BlockTorch object.

      • CheckBuildSpaceForAllowedBlockReplacement

        public static boolean CheckBuildSpaceForAllowedBlockReplacement(StructureConfiguration configuration,
                                                                net.minecraft.world.World world,
                                                                net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos startBlockPos,
                                                                net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos endBlockPos,
                                                                net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)
        This method is used to determine if the player can build the structure.
        Parameters:
        configuration - The structure configuration.
        world - The world to build the structure in.
        startBlockPos - The start location to start checking blocks.
        endBlockPos - The end location for checking blocks. Combined with the startBlockPos, this should be a cube.
        player - The player running this build request.
        Returns:
        True if all blocks can be replaced. Otherwise false and send a message to the player.
